text.author: Andrewssi2, Challenger l, Ikan Kekek and others (see URL)
text.title: Oakland
text.summary: This guide to Oakland describes the city's history since the 1960s and its neighborhoods, including Downtown and its skyline, Chinatown's architecture and bilingual signs, Uptown with its art galleries, theaters and night clubs, North Oakland's commercial centers, foodie heavens, Temescal and Rockridge, and working-class West Oakland.
text.summary2: The guide describes Oakland, a radical culture hub and multicultural “hipster” city neighboring San Francisco in the Bay Area, including its following neighborhoods and some notable landmarks: Downtown, Old Oakland, Chinatown, Jack London Square, USS Potomac, Financial District/Uptown, North Oakland, Temescal, Rockridge, Piedmont Avenue, Grand Lake, Lakeshore, and West Oakland.
